description: Single storey side/rear extension; side (north facing) roof extension; installation of three sets of rooflights to side (north facing) roof slope; replacement of metal balustrade with timber balustrade to first floor roof terrace; insertion of one window to ground floor side (south facing elevation); alterations to fenestration to ground floor side (north facing elevation); alterations of timber fenestration with like-for-like replacements; replacement of roller shutter with garage doors to existing garage; installation of a cycle store within the rear garden; internal alterations to dwellinghouse involving reducing the size of ground floor chimney breast, altering to the ground floor room layouts, reconfiguration of the first floor bathrooms and dressing room involving the relocation of the internal wall, restoration of landing space on second floor and relocating of internal walls (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):  A690/L1 Location Plan; A690/PM01 Existing Ground Floor Plan & Site Plan; A690/PM02 Existing First, Second Floor & Loft Plans; A690/PM03 Existing Front & Side Elevations; A690/PM04 Existing Side & Rear Elevations; A690/PM05 Existing Sections A-A and B-B; A690/PM06 Existing Studio Drawings; A690/PM07 A Design for a Corner House by E W Goodwin; A690/PL01 Proposed Ground Floor Plan & Site Plan; A690/PL02 Proposed First, Second Floor & Loft Plans; A690/PL03 Proposed Front & Side Elevations; A690/PL04 Proposed Side & Rear Elevations; A690/PL05 Proposed Sections A-A & B-B; A690/PL06 Proposed Studio Drawings; A690/PL20 Window Joinery Details with Single Glazing; A690/PL21 Balcony Balustrade Details; A690/PL22 Velux Conservation Rooflight UK04 & FK06 Details; A690/PL23 Bike Store G11.2 Details; Heritage Statement and Design & Access Statement.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless stated on the application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The window/s inserted in the roof extension (northern roofslope) shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane, be Conservation Grade and be fixed shut and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | The replacement of any windows pertaining to the existing Listed Building shall incorporate materials and joinery details that match the existing windows.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the subject Listed Building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
